meanings.definition: An officer in charge of supplies and provisions.
meanings.sent1: The quartermasters ensured the soldiers had enough food and equipment.
meanings.sent2: The quartermasters organized the storage of food and supplies for the army.
meanings.sent3: The quartermasters joked that they were the 'kings of rations' in the army.
meanings.sent4: The quartermasters were the backbone of the army, keeping everyone well-equipped.
meanings.sent5: The quartermasters' role was crucial in keeping the troops well-supplied during the war.

meanings.definition: A person in charge of a ship's equipment and crew.
meanings.sent1: The quartermasters on the ship ensured all equipment was in top condition.
meanings.sent2: The quartermasters directed the crew to maintain the ship's equipment.
meanings.sent3: The quartermasters on the ship were known for their meticulous attention to detail.
meanings.sent4: The quartermasters steered the ship through rough waters with skill and expertise.
meanings.sent5: The quartermasters' leadership kept the ship running smoothly during the voyage.

meanings.definition: A military officer responsible for overseeing supplies and logistics.
meanings.sent1: The quartermasters coordinated the delivery of supplies to the troops.
meanings.sent2: The quartermasters managed the distribution of supplies to different units.
meanings.sent3: The quartermasters in the army were nicknamed 'logistics wizards' by the soldiers.
meanings.sent4: The quartermasters strategically planned the supply routes to avoid enemy interference.
meanings.sent5: The quartermasters' efficiency in handling logistics was praised by the commanding officers.
